thread.title: Great, my pc isn't starting up windows. [Solved]

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
Sorry for the threads of PC props, but my PC where I am at "Home PC", isn't starting the Windows up, but it shows the loading screen and after that for maybe 5 mins of a black screen I get a quick blue screen showing the STOP message and showing details about my REGISTERY and after that it restarts itself.

If I keep repeating this proccess for maybe 6 or 5 times it all the sudden works.

I have the Vista Boot CD finaly and I did a System Start Up Repair and it shows no errors.

Is this a hardware related problem with the motherboard or hard drive?

What should I do to help you guys to help me in a way? I don't want to take it to some jack off for 50 bucks and found out it was a wire problem connection and wait a nother week or 2 too get give it too my dad to fix. Plus I could use the experiance.

Also I tried going in safe mode with Networking and it happens too after it loads everything.


Help will be appeciated, thanks ajm113.

post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body:
You could try booting from a CD and then running system file checker(sfc.exe) it will replace any system .dll's with the original defaults from your install disk in the case that they've been altered somehow. That's gotten me out of it before, sorry I could'nt be more helpful. It does sound like a software or driver problem to me because of the .dll message you said you were getting. Here's more info about running sfc.exe:

http://vistasupport.mvps.org/system_file_checker.htm

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
Ok, I got my PC up after 3 hr or 2 of reinstalling it.

It must have been a virus or program really Fing up my Reg files.

I request a thread lock.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
ajm113 wrote:
I request a thread lock.


Granted
